												Searching for keys in a dark room. See mary at the door. Close and block the door. Turn around, see mary again, get killed and then laugh/cry/rage about it.This is probably the scariest game I've played so far, mainly because it's an actual play controlling the monsters.Each monster has different play-styles and the survivors have to learn to adapt to them. If you don't, you'll die.This is one of those games where you get the four pack, give it to your friends and start playing it. I've played many hours of this game and I'ts STILL scary. The ambience doesn't help much either.The mechanics of the game are very fun to play with while being difficult at the same time. You're always running back and forth finding keys and trying to figure out what opens what. That doesn't sound scary, right? Try adding a monster that you can't effect in any physical way.This game is lacking in content for the price, but more content will be added eventually, probably a new map or monster.I continue to play this game, and I will for a long time. Great work 9heads!(And those who are complaining about low FPS, try restarting your computer and running it again, it's most likely a bug in the version of Python they used)

								damned is an absolutely terrifying game that really pulls you in with its groundbreaking story. you play as a flashlight with no memory of his tragic past. you wake up in a room and make some friends controlled by strangers because you don't have any friends in real life and you all go on a fun scavenger hunt looking for items such as keys and crowbars and combinations to safes that contain items such as keys and crowbars and combinations to safes. however, it's soon discovered that you are trapped in a spooky kitchen and all of this fun you're having is just delaying your inevitable excruciating death. there's only one way out of this twisted funhouse and that's to be massacred by being left clicked once by someone playing as spooky ghost or low textured meat man. but don't worry, when you get left clicked you can spectate from your comrades' perspectives so you can watch them get left clicked and live the thrilling experience again and again key elements include smooth jazz that plays whenever spooky ghost or low textured meat man are near youeven YOU can be spooky ghost or low textured meat man and YOU can left click people and if they have a heart attack and die because of how absolutely scary this game is then their blood will be on your hands and you can live with that fact until the end of timealso you have to make an account after buying the game so make a username that you want to be stuck with forever because if you want to use another username you'll have to buy the game again for that username too

content:

Early Access Review
								Gonna give it a fast review based on beta as pro/con list:Pros- Unique idea.- Lots of scares with friends.- Mary is the most fun and neat monster to play with or against that produces the most scares.- The settings are nice.- Full random! The keys spawn randomly (although crowbars don't on few levels).Cons- Connection issues and game crashes. The game crashes a lot and the connection seems faulty, it really needs 3rd party servers instead of a host server.- The game is too hard for the survivors, nearly impossible to get through it without dying if the monster knows how to play.- Mary is the most balanced character now. As this is spoiler free, the 2 others can get to the starting area and just kill off everyone in under 2 minutes.- The game NEEDS you to play with friends, you have a very slight chance to have fun with random people.To put it bluntly, the game is nice to play with friends and it's a unique piece of horrorgaming. If you want scary fun with friends, this might be the only game to allow that. It has it's problems but it's still beta! If you can't sit through game crashes or connection issues, then I'll say to wait for the full release.Beta gets about 8/10 =D

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												This game has a really amazing concept to it. It has great horror factors to it, hardly relying on jumpscares as its main focus of fright. It also has unique types of Monsters you can play as; the Lurker (completly blind, but can set audio traps to pin-point where survivers went and manifest into a solid being), the Phantom (another blind Monster, but you can see surivers hinding behind walls or objects once you first see them) and Mary (a spectral girl similar to the Grudge spirit that is always visible, walks very slowly, but has a frenzy attack if she focuses on a surviver for a certain amount of time). Alas, this game is still ridden with terrible flaws that make it hard for me to recommened this game to anyone.FIrst off, they made the mosters waaaaaaaaaaaay overpowered.  They can kill you in one hit and there's no life meter for the survivers. You can set how many lifes you have, but they're shared with the other survivers. Secondly, the survivers have absolutly no way to defend themselves. All you have equiped is your flashlight and whatever you find while scowering whatever place you spawn in (keys, hammers, and crowbars). There are no weapons for you to get to defend yourself from the Monsters. Thirdly, respawing is broken. There's been a few times while playing this game with some of my friends that one of them respawned right next to the Monster. Lastly, there's hidden effects that happen to you, while some are accecptible, others are not. One I think is okay is where your character will start halucenating if your flashlight's battery is low. The other is how stamina is both there and it's not. Sometimes you can run just fine, but then you halt to a walk and can only sometimes run. There's also no meter for your stamina.If this game could get some fixes, I would recommend this game. As it is right now, I just can't justify it as a good game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 10, 2015
												Best Pitch Black Room Simulator of 2015, bar none. Let me tell you.The best part of the game is that it is aparantly built entirely in Python. All the stability and speed of an interpreted language is on display here. THe server list helpful lists games in alphabetical ascii order, where lowercase a comes after uppercase Z. Can't find game aaron aardvark? that's because it's below Zombie Zoomba. Join a game if you dare!Imagine you are in a dark room, you can hold up a flash light, that illuminates a narrow cone for you, but no one else can see it. Now imagine crawling around on your hands and knees though a house looking for tiny keys that open random doors. Which keys open which doors? I have no idea, sometimes you get a decription on the key, but the doors have no names. If you are lucky enough to open a door, hold on to the click button and move back and forth a bit until the door physics freaks out and opens in a random direction. Sometimes you hear scary music which means it is action time.Begin action time. If they are a powerful monster, you are should immediately turn off your flashlight and run in a random direction. You are dead anyway, but this might make them waste 0.03 seconds which might allow one of your friends to escape. If they are a weak monster, turn off your flashlight and run in a random direction. You will sometimes live, beacuse the monster will get caught on a jagged edge and spin in space randomly. Success! Please note, unlike humans, monsters CAN see flashlights. They have monster eyes.Ok, you have been crawling around lost in the house and/or creepy woods (you can tell it is creepy because there are jack-o-lantern's every 17.2 feet in every hallway, that's how you know it's scary) for a long time, and you have not seen a battery to click on in a while, and OH NOES YOUR BATTERY IS DEAD. Begin pitch dark screen simulator. On the macbook pro it is especailly convincing, because the monitor doesn't even turn on! You are in the pitch dark, you can see nothing, hope is lost, except that it might take the monster another 20 minutes to find you because he has a hard time seeing you because he only sees flashlights (monster eyes). If you are very lucky and at a LAN party and another dead survivor is in the room with you, he can spectate you and you can screenlook on his screen to help you nagivate. Or he can yell directions to you. My friend Jimmy did this for me, Jimmy you are the best.If you are the monster, life is great, even if you are a bad monster. Walk around randomly. Sometimes a survivor walks in front of you. Turn into a real monster, and click on them. They are dead! Do this 3 more times. You win! Acheivements for everyone! Well, not everyone. Just you. Those poor saps were crwaling on their hands and knees trying to figure out how to open a cabinet with the wierd door physics trying to find a key which may or may not exist for the unlabeled door. Puny scum! Also, half of them probably have crippling graphical glitches, like a serverlist of games to join blocking most of their screen. That's the breaks! After 7 games of the survivors never managing to open more than a few doors, convince the monster to stay put and try to let the survivors win one game. After an hour of trying to find keys with 4 survivors and no monster, turn off game, unable to find door or even begin to understand the win condition. You are a winner!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												This one of the very few reviews I've written. I am annoyed enough to actually write one.A number of my friends and I acquired this game through a recent Humble Bundle, expecting a few hours' fun with what reads like a really nice idea for an asymmetric multiplayer game. What we got was a bug ridden, slowly performing, confusing mess across multiple different systems. Let me explain.The game has many problems, most obviously bugs: menus appearing unexpectedly and staying there throughout gameplay; unexpected freezing which forces a quit to menu or process kill; bizarre drops in mouse sensitivity or input tracking; variable framerates; disconnects from multiplayer games yet remaining in the player list; minimal feedback on player/monster actions; the list goes on. We were playing on a mixture of systems, some with NVidia cards and some with AMD, all using Windows 7, and I can say now that we've not had anywhere near as many problems with any other game. The next bunch of issues relate to the game design itself. The basic elements of the gameplay are there, but they seem to be at the level found in a lot of early version mods available for other games. Playing as any of the monsters is actually very shallow in terms of gameplay, and playing as the survivors doesn't really feel like anything beyond semi-coordinated trial and error. There's barely any interaction with levels beyond picking items up and opening doors, the latter of which has a needlessly awkward grab mechanic that in practice doesn't justify its existence. The items are difficult to spot as well, which results in the survivor's role rapidly becoming one of frustration and confusion, especially when playing a new level. As a group Damned sounded fun, and we play in a LAN environment so we hoped the horror aspect would make it a good investment. As it turns out the gameplay is barely fleshed out, and when the game does run it either runs very badly or encounters problems. I just can't recommend it, not with many other games offering much better for a lot less than the Steam price at the time of writing (£15).The worst bit? We experienced all the above in an hour. A single hour. It literally took 60 minutes to exhaust patience of five PC gamers who are happy to mod, tweak, upate drivers, and customise controls, in order to get something working. Did we give it enough time? You decide; we found something else to play.

Great atmosphere with simple and easy to get into gameplay mechanics, plus having had the "horror"/thriller multiplayer market cornered back in it's prime when it released.Excellent game to play with four other friends + monster.That being said, the developers simply stopped giving a ♥♥♥♥. Game has glaring issues and bugs which, coupled with the seriously lacking graphics department, really brings players out of the experience- less than a handful of updates to speak of.Now with much better titles at the consumer's disposal like Dead By Day Light and the upcoming Friday The 13th game, Damned seems to be at the precipice from which it'll surely fade into obscurity.Unless the developers step in and actually put some work into this, their already non existant community will continue to dwindle, deservedly so.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												You are probably thinking: This game is probably fun! I can be monster and scare the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of my friends! No. Im gonna tell you why. This game is online, 5 players or less per round. 4 survivors one monster. The survivors job is to find keys and unlock doors. The monsters job is to scare the players and later kill them. But for the monster it is almost impossible. There are 3 monsters: Lurker, mary and phantom. The lurker can go invisible and run pretty fast! Sounds cool right? But when you are invisible you can`t see the other players. There is no reason to be invisible. Marry can teleport to random places, but she walk like a snail, can`t decide were to teleport and teleports randomly even though you did not want to. Phantom. Phantom is just horrible. He have no powers at all. He can`t see players, walk, can`t run and the only good thing is when you are basically inside another player you discover them, and you have x-ray vision for like 10 seconds before you can`t see them anymore. 3/10

												pros-*multiplayer horror game*doesnt need port forwarding*can be played on 30kbps without lag*cheap on♥♥♥♥♥br>*simple controls*doesnt take a monster pc to runcons-*phantom is over powering (basically has a built in flashlight and can see you through walls*mary needs a slight speed buff*theres a closet with a door that ppl can glitch behind* the clone limitation for fallen angel*some room cause fps drops*no A.I. mode or survivors vs AI monstor*only 4 monsters to select from*ppl kick you for no reason from public lobbies*too many privete lobbies*no ingame text chat for spectators*game is not worth 20$ (only worth about 5$)all in all it a good game and worth buying if you buy it from♥♥♥♥♥...I recommend the game not the price they want for it

												While this game is fun, it needs to be remade with a different and better engine.The monsters need to have different variables when it comes to each stage. Some stages are very narrow making monsters (especially the Phantom) way too powerful. What I'm trying to sya is that mosnters aren't overpowered- It's just certain stages are not appropriate for select monsters. Monster abilities/stats be allowed to make friendly changes would be nice.
